docs.abstract: While Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google have all drawn attention to how they dominate markets, the reasons are as different as the companies.
docs.snippet: While Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google have all drawn attention to how they dominate markets, the reasons are as different as the companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google have been the envy of corporate America, admired for their size, influence and remarkable growth.

headline.main: How Each Big Tech Company May Be Targeted by Regulators

byline.original: By Jack Nicas, Karen Weise and Mike Isaac

docs.abstract: Sketching is a form of visual thinking that exercises the mind and body, and it’s easy to turn your tablet into a portable art studio.
docs.snippet: Sketching is a form of visual thinking that exercises the mind and body, and it’s easy to turn your tablet into a portable art studio.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Any one who can learn to write, can learn to draw,” John Gadsby Chapman wrote in his 19th-century instruction manual, “The American Drawing-Book.” This can-do sentiment dates back to an era when lead pencils and chalky pastels were standard. Today’s artists — and wannabe artists — also have the option of easy-to-use digital gadgets.

headline.main: Can You Draw This? Of Course You Can

docs.abstract: The fine, from the Federal Trade Commission, could have significant repercussions for other social media platforms that are popular with children.
docs.snippet: The fine, from the Federal Trade Commission, could have significant repercussions for other social media platforms that are popular with children.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission has voted to fine Google $150 million to $200 million to settle accusations that its YouTube subsidiary illegally collected personal information about children, according to three people briefed on the matter.

headline.main: YouTube Said to Be Fined Up to $200 Million for Children’s Privacy Violations
headline.print_headline: YouTube Fine Over Privacy May Be Up to $200 Million

byline.original: By Natasha Singer, Jack Nicas and Kate Conger

docs.abstract: Its “Evil Empire” moniker, once a label favored by the company’s critics, has fallen by the wayside.
docs.snippet: Its “Evil Empire” moniker, once a label favored by the company’s critics, has fallen by the wayside.
docs.lead_paragraph: Google, Facebook, Amazon and Apple are targets of government investigations and public outrage, facing accusations that they abuse their power in various ways, from exploiting personal information to stifling rivals.

headline.main: How Top-Valued Microsoft Has Avoided the Big Tech Backlash
headline.print_headline: Older and Wiser, Microsoft Avoids Scrutiny and Blame

docs.abstract: China’s first duplicate cat marks the country’s emergence in gene research and its entry in a potentially lucrative and unregulated market for cloning pets.
docs.snippet: China’s first duplicate cat marks the country’s emergence in gene research and its entry in a potentially lucrative and unregulated market for cloning pets.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Garlic was dead, and there was nothing Huang Yu could do. So on a cold winter day, he buried his cat’s body in a park close to his home.

headline.main: His Cat’s Death Left Him Heartbroken. So He Cloned It.
headline.print_headline: The Cat Is Dead, Long Live the Cat

docs.abstract: The ratings firm cited Beijing’s growing influence over the city, suggesting that the barriers separating their legal and financial systems were blurring.
docs.snippet: The ratings firm cited Beijing’s growing influence over the city, suggesting that the barriers separating their legal and financial systems were blurring.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hong Kong’s economy, already damaged by weeks of protests, was dealt a further blow on Friday when Fitch Ratings downgraded its credit rating on the territory, citing China’s growing influence in the territory’s affairs.

headline.main: Fitch Downgrades Hong Kong Over China’s Stronger Hand
headline.print_headline: Fitch Downgrades Hong Kong Credit Rating

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies

docs.abstract: Stocks rebounded as the United States and China scheduled further discussions, but there is little sign of tangible progress.
docs.snippet: Stocks rebounded as the United States and China scheduled further discussions, but there is little sign of tangible progress.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s decision to renew talks with China in the coming weeks sent financial markets soaring on Thursday, as investors seized on the development as a sign that both sides could still find a way out of an economically damaging trade war.

headline.main: Markets Soar on News of China Talks, but Hopes for Progress Are Low
headline.print_headline: Investors Take Solace in News  Of China Talks

byline.original: By Ana Swanson and Matt Phillips

docs.abstract: A settlement is about 1.7 percent of the parent company Alphabet’s profit in its most recent quarter.
docs.snippet: A settlement is about 1.7 percent of the parent company Alphabet’s profit in its most recent quarter.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, we review the week’s news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: YouTube Fined $170 Million Over Child Privacy Violations

docs.abstract: The companies seem to have fallen short in efforts to dodge legislation classifying many workers in the gig economy as employees and not contractors.
docs.snippet: The companies seem to have fallen short in efforts to dodge legislation classifying many workers in the gig economy as employees and not contractors.
docs.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — A pack of Teamsters fanned out through California’s Capitol building last week, marching into legislators’ offices and pressing them to pass a bill that would force Uber and Lyft to treat their drivers as employees. The measure, Assembly Bill 5, would entitle gig workers to protections like a minimum wage and unemployment benefits. “Yes on A.B. 5! Yes on A.B. 5!” they chorused.

headline.main: California Labor Bill, Near Passage, Is Blow to Uber and Lyft
headline.print_headline: Uber and Lyft Face Rebuff On California Rights Bill

byline.original: By Kate Conger and Noam Scheiber

docs.abstract: The chip could improve how quickly artificial intelligence systems can learn tasks. But its complexity and size (as big as a plate) could be a challenge.
docs.snippet: The chip could improve how quickly artificial intelligence systems can learn tasks. But its complexity and size (as big as a plate) could be a challenge.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The largest computer chips would usually fit in the palm of your hand. Some could rest on the tip of your finger. Conventional wisdom says anything bigger would be a problem.

headline.main: To Power A.I., Start-Up Creates a Giant Computer Chip
headline.print_headline: A.I. Needs Power. Enter the Macro Chip.
